actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-412, by Mr. Goss.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 107 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Bill is open to amendments.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 141.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 107) expressing the sense of the Congress that the award of attorneys' fees, costs, and sanctions of $285,864.78 ordered by United States District Judge Royce C. Lamberth on December 18, 1997, should not be paid with taxpayer funds.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.J. Res. 107 (use of taxpayer funds for payment of specified attorney's fees).

titles.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J.
